com.esri.mo2.ui.lyt
Interface Ruler

All Known Implementing Classes:
HorizontalRuler, VerticalRuler
public interface Ruler

This interface defines common methods for horizontal and vertical rulers. It also provides functionality for managing ruler guides. A ruler is either a horizontal or vertical user interface component that show the distance from their origin points. The origin for vertical ruler starts at the bottom while origin for horizontal ruler starts at the left even though the layout's virtual coordinate system's origin is located at the up-left corner of the page panel. A ruler is usually divided into multiple levels of small divisions. For instance, a 8.5 inch (width) by 11.0 inch (height) page, its horizontal ruler could have 8 first level divisions with each one represents 1 inch. A first level division could in turn be divided into 4 second level divisions with each division represents a quarter of inch. A second level division could be again divided into 2 smaller divsions with each represents an eighth of an inch. If there is no further dividing occuring for this ruler, the 3rd level of an eighth of inch will be the smallest division for this ruler. Usually, the ruler will adjust its smallest division automatically based on the scale of the layout.

A guide is a line imposed on top of the layout page, either horizontal or vertical. It has an indicator (icon) within a ruler when it's set. A guide could be set to visible or invisible in the page, when a guide is visible, it will draw a line cross the layout page.

Method Summary
 void clearAllGuides()
          Clears all guides in the ruler
